Explanation of the virtue of good character (Khuluq) and the censure of bad character (Khuluq). Allah the Exalted said to His Prophet and beloved, praising him and manifesting His favor upon him: "And indeed, you are upon a great character (Khuluq)" (Quran 68:4). And Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "The Messenger of Allah's character (Khuluq) was the Quran."[1] And a man asked the Messenger of Allah about good character (Khuluq), so he recited the saying of Allah the Exalted: "Take what is given freely, enjoin what is recognized (Ma'ruf), and turn away from the ignorant." Then he said: "It is that you join what is severed from you, give to one who deprives you, and pardon one who wrongs you."[2] And he said: "I was only sent to perfect noble character (Akhlaq)."[3] And he said: "The least that is placed in the scale on the Day of Resurrection is the God-consciousness (Taqwa) of Allah and good character (Khuluq)."[4] And a man came to the Messenger of Allah from before him and said: O Messenger of Allah, what is religion (Deen)? He said: "Good character (Khuluq)." Then he came to him from his right side and said: O Messenger of Allah, what is religion (Deen)? He said: "Good character (Khuluq)." Then he came to him from his left side and said: What is religion (Deen)? He said: "Good character (Khuluq)." Then he came to him from behind him and said: O Messenger of Allah, what is religion (Deen)? He turned to him and said: "Do you not understand? It is that you do not become angry."[5] And it was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is misfortune? He said: "Bad character (Khuluq)."[6] And a man said to the Messenger of Allah: Advise me. He said: "Fear Allah wherever you are." He said: Increase me. He said: "Follow a bad deed with a good deed that erases it." He said: Increase me. He said: "Treat people with good character (Khuluq)."[7] And he was asked, peace be upon him: Which deeds are best? He said: "Good character (Khuluq)." And he said: "Allah does not beautify the creation (Khalq) and character (Khuluq) of a servant and then feed him to the Fire."[8] And Al-Fudayl said: It was said to the Messenger of Allah, prayers and peace be upon him and his family: Indeed, then.

ğŸ“– Vol 2: Etiquette of Companionship
The virtue of affection and brotherhood: Know that affection is the fruit of good character (Khuluq) and separation is the fruit of bad character (Khuluq). Good character necessitates mutual love, affection, and harmony, while bad character produces mutual hatred, envy, and turning away. Whenever the producer is praiseworthy, the fruit is praiseworthy. The virtue of good character in the religion is not hidden, and it is that with which Allah, glorified be He, praised His Prophet, peace be upon him, when He said: 'And indeed, you are upon a great character (Khuluq).' And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'The most that causes people to enter Paradise is the God-consciousness (Taqwa) of Allah and good character (Khuluq).' The hadith: 'The first to enter Paradise is the God-consciousness (Taqwa) of Allah and good character (Khuluq).' Al-Tirmidhi and Al-Hakim transmitted it from the narration of Abu Hurairah and said its chain is authentic, and it has preceded.

Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
Without making exception.
So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
And it became as though reaped.
And they called one another at morning,
[Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
So they set out, while lowering their voices,
[Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
Rather, we have been deprived."
The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?

And the cure for this delusion (Ghurur) is knowing the signs of honor (Karama) and humiliation (Hawan) either through insight (Bassira) or through imitation (Taqleed). As for insight, it is by knowing how turning toward the desires of the world distances from Allah and how distancing from them brings near to Allah, and one perceives that through inspiration (Ilham) in the stations of the knowers (Arifeen) and the friends (Awliya), and its explanation is among the sciences of unveiling (Mukashafa) and is not suitable for the science of transaction. "And as for knowing it through the way of imitation and belief," it is to have faith in the Book of Allah the Exalted and believe His Messenger. And He the Exalted has said: "Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children, We hasten for them in good things? Rather, they do not perceive." And He the Exalted has said: "So leave Me with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement. We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know." And He the Exalted has said: "We opened to them the gates of every thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and at once they were in despair." And in the interpretation of His saying the Exalted "We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know," it is that whenever they commit a sin, We grant them a blessing to increase their delusion. And He the Exalted has said: "We only give them respite that they may increase in sin." And He the Exalted has said: "And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror]." And other than that which has come in the Book of Allah the Exalted and the Sunnah of His Messenger. So whoever believes in it is freed from this delusion, for the origin of this delusion is ignorance of Allah and His attributes, for whoever knows Him does not feel secure from His plan (Makr) nor is deceived by such false imaginings, and looks at Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah and at the kings of the earth and what happened to themâ€”how Allah was good to them initially then destroyed them utterly! So He the Exalted said: "Do you perceive of them anyone?" the verse. And Allah the Exalted has warned of His plan and gradual leading, saying: "So none feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people." And He the Exalted has said: "And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not." And He the Mighty and Majestic has said: "And they planned, and Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners." And He the Exalted has said: "Indeed, they are planning a plan, and I am planning a plan. So allow time for the disbelievers. Deal with them gently [for a while]." So just as it is not permissible for the neglected servant to infer from the master's neglect of him and enabling.

"And as for knowing it through the way of imitation and belief (Tasdeeq)," it is to have faith in the Book of Allah the Exalted and believe His Messenger. And He the Exalted has said: "Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children, We hasten for them in good things? Rather, they do not perceive." And He the Exalted has said: "We will lead them on step by step from where they do not know." And He the Exalted has said: "We opened to them the gates of every thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and at once they were in despair." And in the interpretation of His saying the Exalted "We will lead them on step by step from where they do not know," it is that whenever they commit a sin, We grant them a blessing to increase their delusion. And He the Exalted has said: "We only give them respite that they may increase in sin." And He the Exalted has said: "And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror]." And other than that which has come in the Book of Allah the Exalted and the Sunnah of His Messenger. So whoever believes in it is freed from this delusion, for the origin of this delusion is ignorance of Allah and His attributes. For whoever knows Him does not feel secure from His plan (Makr) nor is deluded by such false imaginings, and looks at Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah, and at the kings of the earth and what happened to themâ€”how Allah was good to them initially, then destroyed them utterly! So He the Exalted said: "Do you perceive of them anyone?" the verse. And Allah the Exalted has warned of His plan and leading on step by step, saying: "So none feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people." And He the Exalted has said: "And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not." And He the Mighty and Majestic said: "And they planned, and Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners." And He the Exalted has said: "Indeed, they are planning a plan, and I am planning a plan. So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile." So just as it is not permissible for the neglected servant to infer from the master's neglect of him and enabling him with blessings that the master loves him, rather he should beware that this might be a plan and scheme from him, even though the master did not warn him of his own plan, then how much more must that be in the case of Allah the Exalted with His warning.
